command: dd if=/boot/vmlinuz-$(uname -r) of=/var/tmp/vmlinuz.cur bs=1M && sha256sum /var/tmp/vmlinuz.cur baseline/vmlinuz && diff -u <(sha256sum /var/tmp/vmlinuz.cur | awk '{print $1}') <(sha256sum baseline/vmlinuz | awk '{print $1}')
explanation: Copies the active kernel image and compares it to a baseline to detect unauthorized kernel replacement or patching.
rationale_steps: Use dd to copy the current kernel image from /boot to a temporary file.
Compute SHA-256 checksums for the current and baseline kernel images.
Diff the hashes to confirm whether the kernel has been modified.
